Title: Manager, People Analytics
Description:
The Role: 

The Manager, People Analytics will play a critical role in guiding Morningstar’s human capital data capabilities, analyzing this data, and harvesting and sharing insights that support decisions related to our employee experience, workforce, and talent strategies. The role is responsible for the people analytics data functions, and for coordinating with HR and business leaders to inspire change through actionable insights. The role reports to the Head ofStrategy, and Analytics within Morningstar’s People & Culture (HR) function and will work closely with technical/systems experts in Workday, Tableau, PowerBI, and Qualtrics to maintain and advance data/analytics capabilities within an articulated people analytics strategy you’ll help to develop.

The ideal candidate will have experience within a mature people analytics function and can draw on this experience in charting the path for advancing Morningstar’s capability. You will be a strong collaborator with a natural ability to get to the heart of core questions/problems, design research/analytics programs around those problems, execute research plans, develop insights based on the research outputs, and then communicate insights in a manner that is appropriate and actionable for the relevant decision-making audience. Depending on the nature of the analysis/insight, your stakeholders may include employees, managers, HR leadership, Finance leaders, and executive leadership.

This role is based in our Chicago, Toronto or Madrid office. We are operating in a hybrid environment (3 days/in office).

What You’ll Do:

Demonstrate thought leadership on current research approaches and innovative solutions for assessing and measuring the employee experience and talent lifecycle from pre-hire to exit. Partner with HR leadership to design and deliver insights that will inform strategy and help execute on workforce/talent initiatives. Collaborate with other cross-functional teams to identify key business/human capital questions and develop analytics solutions to address them. Support the design and execution of a holistic employee listening strategy, including design and administration of pulse, lifecycle, and ad hoc surveys, and integration of insights across the talent lifecycle. Conduct research and make recommendations on trends, benchmarks, and standard processes to drive the company's long-term talent strategy and effectiveness. Drive continuous improvement by evaluating existing analytics processes and recommending enhancements or new methodologies. Analyze workforce and talent data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in areas such as recruitment, retention, performance, and diversity & inclusion. Interpret complex data sets and communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear, concise, and compelling manner. Partner with HRBPs, business leaders, and other stakeholders to deliver quarterly engagement survey and organizational health insights, analysis, Translate metric priorities into designs/ideas for new dashboards and key reports with compelling visualizations and storytelling to help guide decision-making regarding talent and organizational practices Extract HR, finance, and business data from enterprise technology platforms, and format/wrangle data for analysis and visualization Develop metrics and KPIs to monitor the efficiency, effectiveness, and impact of HR programs Design and develop interactive reports and dashboards to distill large volumes of data into a user-friendly presentation of key insights 


What We’re Looking For:

7+ years business experience, with 3-5 years in a data/people analytics function Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience in data analysis, data modeling, statistical analysis, quantitative and qualitative research methods, forecasts, and predictions. Proven knowledge of, and experience with, end-to-end talent lifecycle measurement and employee experience listening programs. Ability to integrate, analyze, and effectively communicate insights to all levels of the organization, making complex information accessible and compelling through well-organized storyboards, graphics and visual outputs. Experience navigating a global company where cultures, time zones, priorities, and language create interesting challenges for advancing work. Extreme attention to detail and accuracy, with an exceptional results orientation and demonstrated personal initiative and customer centric perspectives. Ability to take a design thinking approach to optimize solutions. Adaptable to work with shifting priorities and comfort operating in an evolving, fast paced environment. Able to work under tight deadlines and plan, organize and carry out multiple, detailed tasks. Working knowledge of HR/analytics systems including Workday, Adaptive Planning, Cornerstone, PowerBI, Qualtrics EX, and AI tools; more intensive knowledge/experience of these systems is a plus. Advanced Excel skills (including functions, macros, and pivot tables) Knowledge of human resources practices, techniques, and standards is a plus Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent work experience. Role can be based in Chicago, NY, London, or Madrid

Title: People Analytics Manager
Description:
Who We Are

Aurora (Nasdaq: AUR) is delivering the benefits of self-driving technology safely, quickly, and broadly to make transportation safer, increasingly accessible, and more reliable and efficient than ever before. The Aurora Driver is a self-driving system designed to operate multiple vehicle types, from freight-hauling semi-trucks to ride-hailing passenger vehicles, and underpins Aurora Horizon and Aurora Connect, its driver-as-a-service products for trucking and ride-hailing. Aurora is working with industry leaders across the transportation ecosystem, including Toyota, FedEx, Volvo Trucks, PACCAR, Uber, Uber Freight, U.S. Xpress, Werner, Covenant, Schneider, and Ryder. For Aurora’s latest news, visit aurora.tech and @aurora_inno on Twitter.

Aurora hires talented people with diverse backgrounds who are ready to help build a transportation ecosystem that will make our roads safer, get crucial goods where they need to go, and make mobility more efficient and accessible for all. We’re searching for a People Analytics Manager.

We are actively seeking an accomplished People Analytics Manager to lead our People Analytics function. This strategic role will involve harnessing advanced data analytics to drive transformative workforce decisions. The People Analytics Manager will serve as a critical partner to the People team and leadership, providing sophisticated insights that elevate our talent acquisition, talent management, employee engagement, and organizational effectiveness strategies.

In This Role, You Will

Strategic Data Leadership:Develop and execute a people analytics strategy aligned with organizational goals.Provide thought leadership on how data and analytics can drive People and business strategy.Advanced Analysis and Forecasting:Conduct sophisticated analyses and predictive modeling to uncover deep insights into workforce trends and behaviors.Forecast future talent needs and workforce dynamics to support strategic planning.Talent Strategy and Development:Collaborate with leadership to shape and refine talent management strategies.Implement advanced analytics to identify and nurture high-potential talent across the organization.Employee Experience:Utilize advanced survey methodologies and sentiment analysis to gauge and improve employee engagement.Design and execute initiatives that enhance the overall employee experience.Organizational Performance Optimization:Work in assessing and optimizing organizational performance.Drive data-driven decision-making to enhance overall operational efficiency and effectiveness.People Technology Innovation:Evaluate emerging technologies and trends in People analytics and make strategic recommendations for adoption.Oversee the implementation and optimization of cutting-edge People analytics tools.Ethical Data Practices and Compliance:Ensure compliance with all relevant data privacy and employment laws in all people analytics practices.Uphold the highest ethical standards in data collection, analysis, and interpretation.
Desired Qualifications

Preferred Master’s degree in Business, Data Science, or a related field.Proven track record of success in senior-level people analytics or a comparable role.Expertise in statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and advanced data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Exceptional strategic thinking and communication skills with the ability to influence executive decision-making.In-depth knowledge of People systems and emerging trends in People technology. Experience with Workday is a plus. 

The base salary range for this position is $135,000-$216,000 per year. Aurora’s pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, the successful candidate’s starting base pay will be determined based on factors including job-related skills, experience, qualifications, relevant education or training, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. The successful candidate will also be eligible for an annual bonus, equity compensation, and benefits.

#Mid-Senior

Working at Aurora

At Aurora, we bring together extraordinarily talented and experienced people united by the strength of our values. We operate with integrity, set outrageous goals, and build a culture where we win together — all without any jerks.

We have offices in several locations across the United States, where we encourage team and cross-functional collaboration. Aurora offers competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, and additional healthcare support including medical transportation reimbursement, fertility, adoption, and surrogacy benefits. We empower our employees and their families with options to further their unique physical, mental, and financial well-being.

Our Learning and Development offerings include Aurora Academy, where our people learn, develop, and practice the essential skills that drive Aurora’s mission, continually up-leveling our team along the way. Our Careers page provides insight into career opportunities at Aurora, and you can find all the latest news on our Blog.

Safety is central to everything we do. Every employee at Aurora has a role in contributing to safety, every step of the way. We seek candidates who take active responsibility, can contribute to building an atmosphere of trust, and invest in the organization's long-term success by working safely — no matter what.

We believe that self-driving technology has broad benefits – including increased access to transportation. To realize those benefits, we need a workforce with diverse experiences, insights, and perspectives — a workforce that reflects the communities our technology will serve.

Aurora is committed to providing access to anyone who seeks information from our website. We invite anyone using assistive technologies, such as a screen reader or Braille reader, to email us at careersiteaccommodations@aurora.tech if they experience difficulty using our website. Please describe the accessibility problem and include a URL (if available).

Aurora considers candidates without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy status, parent or caregiver status, ancestry, political affiliation, veteran and/or military status, physical or mental disability, or any other status protected by federal or state law. Aurora considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at careersiteaccommodations@aurora.tech. 

For California applicants, information collected and processed as part of your application and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Aurora’s California Employment Privacy Policy.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

At Aurora, every employee is empowered to take an active role in building an inclusive, collaborative, and unified culture that leverages our diverse strengths, perspectives, and backgrounds.

Transforming how the world moves people and goods involves seeking to understand backgrounds, insights, and lived experiences that differ from our own. One way we accomplish that is with our 15 employee-led Aurora Unified Groups, which support diverse voices and drive inclusive collaboration. We believe that teamwork, belonging, and trust motivate and support our employees to do their best work. As our team grows, we strive to attract and retain exceptional talent that adds new perspectives and experiences and continues to drive innovation. Learn more on our Culture Page.

Title: Senior Specialist, People Analytics
Description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Why We Have This Role

The People Analytics team is growing as Qualtrics evolves. We use people data to inform and provide insights to decision-makers across the company. The Senior Specialist does this through the creation and dissemination of dashboards, reports, and other visual and statistical data products. The analyst explores opportunities for improving, calibrating, and automating analyses to the company. The analyst meets regularly with company stakeholders to understand the needs of senior leaders and the organization at large regarding issues affecting the Humans of Qualtrics. Qualifications

Basic Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative or related field such as data analytics, business analytics, computer science, engineering, economics, mathematics, or statisticsStrong leadership skills with experience in managing and mentoring teams3+ years of experience in an analytics/quantitative role, preferably within the HR Domain3+ years of experience utilizing BI visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Visier, Domo, etc.5+ years of experience with statistical/analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL, etc.Advanced visualization skills with the ability to tell a compelling story with dataExcellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively present complex data findings to non-technical stakeholdersProject management experienceAdvanced proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Workforce and Labor Analytics
Description:
Universal Orlando Resort believes in-person collaboration is key to our success. Many of our Team Members work in a hybrid capacity, contributing from the workplace a minimum of three days per week. Some remote opportunities are available within specific departments. There are also roles that require being on-site full time. You’ll learn more about this during the application process.

JOB SUMMARY: Formulate and apply advanced analytical approaches, such as statistical modeling, forecasting, machine learning, mathematical optimization, and decision analysis, to name a few, in the production of analytical models, tools, and processes to improve the effectiveness and relevance of our efforts to drive incremental business value for the company.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Explore new, state-of-the-art analytical tools, methodologies, and technology that can be leveraged by our team. Formulate and apply advanced analytical approaches, such as causal and time series forecasting modeling, econometric methods, machine learning modeling, mathematical optimization, to name a few, for complex analyses, predictions and problem-solving. Perform data and error analysis to improve models. Own and drive initiatives end-to-end that deliver business value, from formulating the problem, model building through developing a solution. Lead and manage Analysts, Engineers, Associate Data Scientists and/or Data Scientists. Assist in collecting, cleaning, and organizing data. Analyze large structured and unstructured datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Use business intelligence tools to create and maintain clear and compelling reporting and visualizations to communicate complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Understands and actively participates in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established UO policy, procedures, training and team member involvement activities. Performs other duties as assigned. 

EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree and Master’s degree in industrial engineering, operations research, mathematics, statistics, computer science, decision science, management science, data science, data analytics, or a closely-related field of study is required. Doctoral degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Decision Science, Management Science, Data Science, Data Analytics, or a closely-related field of study preferred.

EXPERIENCE: 7+ years of experience formulating and applying advanced analytical approaches in theme parks, resorts, retail/dining/entertainment venues, hospitality industry, etc. is preferred. 5+ years of applied experience in analytical model design, development and deployment; or a combination of education and experience is required.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: Develop analytical and predictive models and solutions for any and all operating divisions within Universal Destinations & Experiences (UDX) to support key decisions in order to drive incremental business value.

The ideal candidate should not only have a strong foundation in advanced analytical modeling, programming, and data analysis, but should also have a passion for solving real-world problems using data-driven insights, along with the ability to translate and communicate complex data into actionable insights. The candidate will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making processes and contributing to the overall success of the organization. In addition, the person in this role will be responsible for supporting and guiding Analysts, Engineers, Associate Data Scientists and Data Scientists on the use of advanced model development methodologies.

Your talent, skills and experience will be rewarded with a competitive compensation package.

Title: Senior People Insights & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

We are looking for a Senior People Insights and Analytics Specialist to join our People Insights and Analytics team. In this role, you will drive value and empower decision-making by building people data products and partnering with customers across Snowflake to drive better, faster, people decisions using data. You will help us to establish a compelling Snow@Snow story for Snowflake’s customers through the products you build and impact you make.

Preference will be given to candidates who can work from our Dublin, CA or San Mateo, CA offices 2-3 times per week.

AS A SENIOR PEOPLE INSIGHTS AND ANALYTICS SPECIALIST, YOU WILL: 

Design, build, and deliver inspiring people data products using (most often using Streamlit) to enable our internal customers to make better, faster, people decisions.  Work to continuously enhance our reporting and analytics infrastructure, including helping to shape our roadmap, document critical information, and enhance our data integrity Act as an internal consultant by understanding business needs, scoping data requests, synthesizing insights, and recommending solutions to key internal customers  Manage people metrics and creation of materials for Snowflake leaders, identifying key trends behind people data Create concise and effective executive level presentations weaving together data and actionable insights from across the employee lifecycle Proactively identify and resolve data issues Motivate and teach users to consume Analytics tools and products in their daily work. 


OUR IDEAL SENIOR PEOPLE INSIGHTS AND ANALYTICS SPECIALIST WILL HAVE:

Strong SQL skills 5+ years of experience in the people analytics space Previous experience building people analytics focused dashboards Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong collaboration skills with technical and non-technical partners Ability to generate clear, concise, and (when appropriate) executive-ready actionable recommendations Experience with People related metrics and topic areas Strong data visualization & storytelling skills An innate curiosity in understanding the “why”  


BONUS POINTS FOR THE FOLLOWING:

Knowledge & Experience with Workday HCM, Ashby or ServiceNow for HR Knowledge & Experience with Snowflake Knowledge & Experience with Python, Streamlit especially 


Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.

The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:

 The estimated base salary range for this role is $147,000 - $205,800.Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan.


The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.

Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

Title: Manager, People Analytics & Reporting
Description:
The Manager, People Analytics & Reporting will partner with colleagues from across human resources and internal customers to provide evidence-based insights on the people and organizational aspects of Regeneron’s business. The ideal candidate will have a fundamental technical background, strong project management skills, customer orientation and requisite HR experience. Expertise in data management, metrics and reporting, descriptive and predictive analytics, data visualization and story-telling are all critical for success in this role. We see this as a phenomenal opportunity to build people analytics expertise working closely with others who have been shaping an enterprise-wide people analytics program.

The role is hybrid 3 days onsite, based at our HQ campus in Sleepy Hollow, NY. This role is not open to fully remote-based work arrangements.

As the Manager, People Analytics & Reporting, a typical day might include the following:

Building new—and updating existing—datasets to support custom analytics projects, spanning descriptive and predictive analyticsSupporting ongoing reporting for both HR and business leadership audiences, including opportunities for automation and efficiencyEnhancing reporting and data transformation to improve Regeneron’s evidence-based approach to HR managementTranslating metric priorities into new dashboards and key reports with compelling visualizations and storytelling to help guide decision-making regarding Regeneron’s talent and organizational practicesIdentifying, prioritizing and implementing improved data quality and additional data capture opportunities in partnership with HR Technology, IT and Finance teamsWorking closely with colleagues to build and integrate the practice of using data to inform people-related decisions

This Job Might Be For You If

You have high attention to detail and can easily shift gears between ongoing work and ad hoc requestsYou have the ability to balance multiple projects, while informing key partners of progress and outcomesYou can handle ambiguity and are highly adaptable and flexible to changing requirements and business demandsYou possess the demonstrated ability to work with large and disparate datasets and appreciate ways to work with imperfect information, maintaining a practical, business-oriented mindsetYou have learning agility and a desire to keep up with the latest developments in the field of HR reporting, analytics and related technology

To be considered for this opportunity, you must have a minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in an applied social science or quantitative field. Preferably with 7+ years of experience working with HR, People and Business data to generate critical insights (ideally including working with big data, integrated business data, global data, labor market data and third-party data). This includes expertise in managing data collection, organization and quality assurance for the purposes of building statistical models, leading metrics and sustainable reporting. Advanced proficiency in statistical software packages (e.g., R, Python, SAS, SPSS) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik) is required. Experience with global HR technology systems and human capital platforms (e.g., Workday) is also required.

Title: Advanced Analytics Manager
Description:
Description

At Audible, we believe stories have the power to transform lives. It’s why we work with some of the world’s leading creators to produce and share audio storytelling with our millions of global listeners. We are dreamers and inventors who come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to empower and inspire each other. Imagine your future with us.

About This Role

As an Advanced Analytics Manager within Audible’s Analytics and Data Science group, you'll be responsible for surfacing data-driven opportunities for the business functions (Content, Marketing, Product, and/or New Growth/International). You'll provide tactical, operational, economic, and financial analysis to frame and drive decisions, and develop KPIs and scorecards to track initiative progress/performance and scientific models to drive a focus on results and execution. You'll partner with engineering and data science to marketing and product management – and develop the knowledge and skill to be a trusted technical advisor across a wide range of business areas.

About You

You are a “doer”, someone that can code at an excellent level, and likes to take ownership of data products or prototypes (being involved in conception, to design, to specification, to code, to test, to measurement, to presentation). You are able to work with minimal instruction and oversight, conduct multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, maintain relationships with senior leaders, and own deliverables end to end. You have an ability to think intentionally, develop insightful analysis, communicate findings concisely to leadership, work effectively as part of a cross functional team, and analyze big data. You are self-motivated with the capacity to work under tight deadlines, have a passion for the accuracy, relevance, quality, and impact of deliverables and possess high attention to detail. You have good written and oral communication/presentation skills and an ability to reconcile information from and for multiple stakeholders, and to manage communication across different audiences (technical vs. business, junior vs. senior). You have an intellectual curiosity for what drives the business, along with the aptitude and drive to learn new tools quickly.

As an Advanced Analytics Manager, you will...

 Illustrate key business trends and drivers through effective problem framing, data analysis, interpretation and visualization Create well designed management scorecards and dashboards that ensure accurate and robust reporting across key business/project/initiative metrics Deliver impactful analysis based on robust economic, financial, and statistical analysis Estimate the impact of different scenarios using robust analytical/financial models Develop and validate methods to optimize the Who, When, Where and How of all our interactions with customers, and demonstrate a good command of data science techniques that can be drawn upon in that context Develop an in-depth knowledge of all relevant data sources, business intelligence technologies and analytical tools - Know to leverage all of our assets to answer senior executive questions fast Develop compelling presentations and documents - and communicate them with impact and intuition Proactively communicate factors affecting deliverables to senior management Explain assumptions and quantitative methodologies to colleagues in their and other teams

About Audible

Audible is the leading producer and provider of audio storytelling. We spark listeners’ imaginations, offering immersive, cinematic experiences full of inspiration and insight to enrich our customers daily lives. Our Hub+Home hybrid workplace model gives employees the flexibility between gathering in a common office space (work from hub) and remote work (work from home). For more information, please visit adbl.co/hybrid.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Newark, NJ, USA

Basic Qualifications

 3+ years of relevant experience in the areas of Strategic Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science, or Consulting in a digital environment or in a related field Quantitative degree (Sciences, Operations Research (OR), Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar field) or equivalent experience in a data driven/analytical role Experience with data/analytical tools Strong experience with SQL Experience using data visualization tools like Tableau or Microstrategy Experience with statistics and modeling Experience with Python, R, Jupyter, other analytics/data science tools

Preferred Qualifications

 MS degree (Sciences, Operations Research (OR), Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar field) or equivalent experience in a data driven/analytical role Proficiency in Python, R or other analytics/data science tools Excellent written and oral communication/presentation skills Background in content/media, marketing tech, subscription business, and/or internet industries An understanding of ecommerce analytics, marketing analytics, experimentation, membership/loyalty analytics and revenue management techniques

Title: Director of Reporting & Analytics
Description:
Strength in Trust

OneTrust is the trust intelligence cloud platform organizations use to transform trust from an abstract concept into a measurable competitive advantage. Organizations globally use OneTrust to enable the responsible use of data while protecting the privacy rights of individuals, implement and report on their cyber security program, make their social impact goals a reality, and create a speak up culture of trust. Over 14,000 customers use OneTrust's technology, including half of the Global 2,000. OneTrust currently ranks #24 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list of top private cloud companies in the world and employs over 2,000 people in regions across North America, South America, Asia, Europe, and Australia.

The Challenge

We are looking for a talented, self-directed, hands-on technical leader to manage Business Intelligence engineers on the OneTrust’s Data Team. As a Director Analytics at OneTrust, you will be responsible for creating architecture and BI (Business Intelligence) solutions that are aligned to OneTrust’s business growth and addresses short-term and long-term analytics needs.

We are looking for an energetic, self-starter with a results-oriented spirit and the ability to navigate a rapidly changing landscape. The right candidate enjoys and excels at team building and development, as well as collaborating across functions. If you take pride in your technical expertise, have a passion for innovation and a desire to improve the Data and Analytics solutions across OneTrust, this job is perfect for you!

Your Mission

You will build team of BI Analysts and Data Scientist and work closely with business functions such as Sales, Marketing, and Finance to understand the requirements and collaborate with Data Engineering team in designing robust and scalable BI Solutions to enable reporting, dashboard development and data science models Analyze Information and reporting business requirements, explore and evaluate various options, develop prototype using reporting and dashboard tools upfront in the project life cycle thereby validating the requirements, eliminating ambiguity and providing early visibility to business on the final solution Work with stakeholders to identify the roadmap and propose initiatives You will also be a key contributor to the Data Analytics and roadmap Ensure the Business Intelligence Team's execution of projects, strategic initiatives, and operational responsibilities with the highest level of accuracy and reliability Disseminate and present reporting deliverables as a storyteller, working to uncover and tie analytical insights to business stakeholders. Translate data metrics, and business process analysis into data product requirements and identify product roadmap that will enable business functions to be more effective Manage, mentor, and grow a team of Business Intelligence Developers and Analysts Translate the requirements to functional specifications document, develop and own requirements traceability matrix Act as resident Data Analytics and Power BI expert 

You Are

This hands-on Director Analytics role demands excellent knowledge and can demonstrate best practices in the industry.

Your Experience Includes

Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field At least 10 years in analytics, business intelligence, reporting and data science 5+ years of experience as BI reporting and visualization engineer along with strong hands-on experience in developing complex reports and dashboards for Enterprise usage Building and leading teams of BI Analysts and Data Scientists Roadmap ownership and driving prioritization. Headcount and capacity planning Collaborating with Data Engineering teams for data models and designs Working in a high-growth, fast-paced environment Proficient in building and publishing customized interactive reports and dashboards Must have strong consultative, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Good understanding of business functions such as Sales, Marketing, Finance, Customer success, etc. Prior experience of developing and implementing reporting solutions in one or multiple areas such as Sales, Marketing & Operations/Finance/Customer Success Strong Datawarehouse knowledge and ability to write SQL Working knowledge and experience in Data Science technologies Understanding and hands on experience in AI/ML and data science. Implementation of Advanced Analytical insight solutions Strong hands-on dashboard development experience using Tableau/PowerBI Passionate about solving business problems, Innovative, creative and an outside-the-box mindset. Proven track record in developing technical skills sets and preparing technical contributors for the next level Fanatical attention to detail with a positive can-do attitude 

For California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, and Washington-based candidates: the annual base pay range for this role is listed below. Within this range, individual pay is determined by several factors, including location, job-related skills, work experience, and relevant education and/or training. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses, equity, and/or commissions, as well as benefits.

Salary Range

$187,900—$281,875 USD

Where we Work

OneTrust embraces a hybrid working model. Our Working@ OneTrust initiative is our way of clarifying where we hire, how we work together, and where we’re located in that hybrid model.

The underlying “why” for Working@ is that we are intentional about the culture that we want to create together. That includes bringing teams together, in-person, throughout the year to collaborate, build connections, learn from each other, and celebrate our wins to Finish Stronger.

We are committed to a flexible approach informed by a set of guiding principles. You’ll see that reflected in our worker designations: “Office-flex” and “Location-flex”.

Office-flex: Like a traditional hybrid model, OneTrust “Office-flex” employees may be asked to work in an office periodically if they are within a commutable distance to a OneTrust office. This includes coming into the office for our Company Kickoff, Company All Hands, and other larger company events. Beyond that, we give our leaders and teams the flexibility to set additional guidelines based on the nature of your role. Location-flex: Similar to other companies’ remote policies, for OneTrust “Location-flex" roles, you will primarily work from your home office location. However, you may be required to travel to our OneTrust offices or customer sites periodically based on the nature of your role.

Each role may have specific requirements, so we encourage you to verify the location of the role with your recruiter during your first interview.

Benefits

As an employee at OneTrust, you will be part of the OneTeam. That means you’ll receive support physically, mentally, and emotionally so that you can do your best work both in and out of the office. This includes comprehensive healthcare coverage, flexible PTO, equity stock options, annual performance bonus opportunities, retirement account support, 14+ weeks of paid parental leave, career development opportunities, company-paid privacy certification exam fees, and much more. Specific benefits differ by country. For more information, talk to your recruiter or visit onetrust.com/careers.

Resources

Check out the following to learn more about OneTrust and its people:

OneTrust Careers on YouTube@LifeatOneTrust on Instagram

Your Data

You have the right to have your personal data updated or removed. You also have the right to have a copy of the information OneTrust holds about you. Further details about these rights are available on the website in our Privacy Overview. You can change your mind at any time and have your personal data removed from our database. In order to do this you must contact us and let us know you wish to be removed. The request should be made on the Data Subject Request Form.

Our Commitment to You

When you join OneTrust you are stepping onto a launching pad — the countdown has begun. The destination? A career without boundaries working alongside a diverse and inclusive crew who is passionate about doing meaningful work. As a pioneer, your voice and expertise will help chart the direction of an entirely new industry — Trust. Our commitment to putting people first starts with you. Your growth is part of the mission. Our goal is to give you the power to embark on the next phase of your uniquely, unique career
